plugins.name: aws-s3
plugins.description: AWS S3 - Cloud object storage

plugins.name: boards
plugins.description: Modern Kanban Boards Photon Task management for humans and AI. Use named instances (`_use('project-name')`) for per-project boards. Perfect for project planning, AI working memory across sessions, and human-AI collaboration on shared tasks.

plugins.name: code-diagram
plugins.description: Code Diagram - Mermaid visualization from source code

plugins.name: connect-four
plugins.description: Connect Four - Play against AI with distributed locks Classic Connect Four game where you drop discs into columns trying to get four in a row. The AI opponent uses minimax with alpha-beta pruning to play strategically. Distributed locks ensure no two moves happen simultaneously - critical when multiple clients connect to the same game.

plugins.name: daemon-features
plugins.description: Daemon Features - Scheduled Jobs, Webhooks, Locks, Pub/Sub

plugins.name: dashboard
plugins.description: Dashboard Photon A sleek dashboard demonstrating MCP Apps with UI templates. Each tool returns data that can be rendered in its linked UI. Data is persisted to ~/.photon/dashboard/data.json

plugins.name: data-sync
plugins.description: Data Sync Workflow - Synchronizes data between sources

plugins.name: demo
plugins.description: Demo - Feature showcase Comprehensive demonstration of Photon runtime features: return types, parameters, progress indicators, user input (elicitation), state management, and UI formats.

plugins.name: deploy
plugins.description: Deploy Pipeline - Multi-step workflow with checkpoints and approval gates

plugins.name: docker
plugins.description: Docker - Container management

plugins.name: email
plugins.description: Email - SMTP and IMAP email operations

plugins.name: expenses
plugins.description: Expenses — Track spending with budgets and summaries

plugins.name: feature-showcase
plugins.description: Feature Showcase - Core Runtime Feature Demos Demonstrates every major Photon runtime feature with test methods to prove each one works. Run `photon test feature-showcase` to verify.

plugins.name: filesystem
plugins.description: Filesystem - File and directory operations

plugins.name: form-inbox
plugins.description: Form Inbox - Webhook-powered form submission collector

plugins.name: format-showcase
plugins.description: Format Showcase - Auto-UI Format Demos Demonstrates every auto-UI format type with sample data so developers can see how each visualization looks and choose appropriately. Run any method in Beam to see the visual output.

plugins.name: git-box
plugins.description: Git Box - Mailbox-style Git interface, manage repos like an inbox

plugins.name: git
plugins.description: Git - Local git repository operations

plugins.name: github-issues
plugins.description: GitHub Issues - Manage repository issues

plugins.name: google-calendar
plugins.description: Google Calendar - Schedule and manage events

plugins.name: hello-world
plugins.description: Hello World - The simplest possible photon A photon is just a TypeScript class where each method becomes an MCP tool.

plugins.name: input-showcase
plugins.description: Input Showcase

plugins.name: integration-demo
plugins.description: Integration Demo — Dependencies, Assets, Stateful Workflows

plugins.name: jira
plugins.description: Jira - Issue tracking and project management

plugins.name: kanban
plugins.description: Kanban Board Photon Task management for humans and AI. Use named instances (`_use('project-name')`) for per-project boards. Perfect for project planning, AI working memory across sessions, and human-AI collaboration on shared tasks.

plugins.name: kitchen-sink
plugins.description: Kitchen Sink Photon Demonstrates every feature of the Photon runtime with meaningfully named functions. Use this as a reference for building your own photons.

plugins.name: math
plugins.description: Calculator - Math expression evaluator Evaluate math expressions with functions like sqrt, sin, cos, mean, median, etc.

plugins.name: mcp-orchestrator
plugins.description: MCP Orchestrator - Combine multiple MCPs into powerful workflows

plugins.name: mongodb
plugins.description: MongoDB - Flexible document-oriented database

plugins.name: postgres
plugins.description: PostgreSQL - Powerful relational database

plugins.name: preferences
plugins.description: Preferences Photon - MCP App with UI assets and settings

plugins.name: progressive-rendering
plugins.description: Progressive Rendering - Same Data, Better Display Six methods return the same team data, each progressively enhanced.

plugins.name: redis
plugins.description: Redis - High-performance in-memory data store

plugins.name: slack
plugins.description: Slack - Send and manage messages

plugins.name: spreadsheet
plugins.description: Spreadsheet API - Read, update and manage CSV files with formula support Common use cases: - Load a CSV file and interact with it like a spreadsheet - Read specific cells, rows, or columns - Update cells (supports formulas starting with =) - Compute values based on formulas

plugins.name: sqlite
plugins.description: SQLite - File or in-memory SQL database

plugins.name: tasks-basic
plugins.description: Tasks Basic — Stateless task list A simple todo list that works during a session but loses state on restart. Compare with tasks-live to see what persistence adds.

plugins.name: tasks-live
plugins.description: Tasks Live — Persistent reactive task list Same as tasks-basic but tasks survive restarts and UI updates in real-time. Uses `this.memory` for zero-boilerplate persistence.

plugins.name: team-dashboard
plugins.description: Team Dashboard Photon A TV/monitor-optimized dashboard that aggregates data from multiple photons to give the whole team visibility into project progress. Perfect for office displays, war rooms, or remote team syncs.

plugins.name: team-pulse
plugins.description: Team Pulse — Async standup with team feed

plugins.name: time
plugins.description: Time - Timezone and time conversion Timezone-aware time operations using native Node.js Intl API (zero dependencies).

plugins.name: todo
plugins.description: Todo List - Reactive collections in action Demonstrates Photon's reactive arrays: just use normal array methods (push, splice, filter) and the runtime automatically emits events so connected UIs update in real-time.

plugins.name: weather
plugins.description: Weather - Current weather and forecasts Zero-dependency weather API wrapper using Open-Meteo (free, no key required).

plugins.name: web
plugins.description: Web - Search and read webpages
